body.name: CORSAIR iCUE 7000X RGB Full-Tower ATX PC Case, Black
body.stockDetail: Only 1 left in stock - order soon.
features: Build in Full View: The 7000X RGB showcases your system behind three gorgeous tempered glass panels while making it easy to build and cool thanks to clever cable management and a spacious interior
CORSAIR RapidRoute Cable Management System: Makes it simple to route your major cables through a single hidden channel, with an easy-access hinged door and 30 mm of space behind the motherboard
Four Included 140 mm RGB Fans: CORSAIR SP RGB ELITE PWM fans feature eight individually addressable RGB LEDs per fan and utilise AirGuide technology to concentrate airflow and enhance cooling
Smart RGB and Fan Speed Control: An included CORSAIR iCUE COMMANDER CORE XT Controller, CORSAIR iCUE software and PWM fan repeater enable RGB and fan speed control out of the box

Colossal Cooling Potential: A massive interior acco mmodates up to 12x 120 mm or 7x 140 mm cooling fans, and makes it possible to install multiple radiators for extreme cooling.Customisable Side Fan Mounts: Side-mount up to 4x 120 mm fans or up to a 420 mm radiator, opening up a new world of cooling options..Accessories included with this case are located in the hard drive bay of the product.
body.description: The CORSAIR iCUE 7000X RGB full-tower ATX case puts your build on display behind three tempered glass panels. CORSAIR RapidRoute cable management easily keeps your cables hidden from sight, while a massive interior enables a multitude of cooling options, including room for up to three simultaneous 360mm radiators and customizable side fan mounts that accommodate up to a 420mm radiator. Four included CORSAIR SP140 RGB ELITE fans deliver amazing lighting and concentrated airflow, controlled by an included iCUE COMMANDER CORE XT. Show off your components behind a tool-free tempered glass panel and add your own personal touch with a customizable windowed PSU shroud complete with a three-slot vertical GPU mount. With room for up to ten storage drives, a front I/O panel including a USB Type-C port and four USB 3.0 ports, and easy-access hinged side doors, you can build your magnum opus in the 7000X RGB.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.6 4.6 out of 5 stars 802 ratings 4.6 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing case, and is absolutely massive, premium price, premium product.
reviews.reviewText: I gotta say this case is massive compared to my old 4000D airflow(comparison in attatched photos), but I need it to cool my parts and didn't wanna have to upgrade the case ever again. Despite how many features it has its actually pretty easy to build in and has 4 140mm fans, plus 2 fan hubs with 6 headers each for fans using the included commander core and a small pre installed fan hub. Case is massive and the thing easily fits my noctua NH-15 cooler and 3080 gpu. I would however say that the major complaint I have is the class pannels, because they restrict airflow ALOT, so I just took them off later on and Temps reduced. Cable management is pretty good, I'm just bad at it, but it is kinda tricky to route the pc fans from the front to the hub if you have fans in the side optional compartment spot, but it's possible. Overall really happy with this case and can't wait to see what else I can do with it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Arrived next day shipping. Shipping box was a little worn but upon opening product it was in perfect condition. Many different fan options to choose from and plenty of room for everything. Easy to work inside of case during parts installation. Only minor drawback was moving the front 3 140mm fans to the top. Fan cables were routed through the partition to divert air over mobo. Had to cut a zip tie that was difficult to reach to remove fans and then secure cables again. Bigger and more detailed instructions would be helpful to a beginner on how to disassemble the parts in the case. Would like to have had covers for some of the larger openings on the cable side of the case with rubber grommets like the other cable routing holes. Corsair needs to put out a very easy and descriptive chart regarding Commander daisy chains for multiple fans. 15 fans installed and was a bit of a guessing game on how to set up for power/rgb. Overall very happy with aesthetics, quality of build, ease of access and large door panel removal/installation. Case keeps temps about 5-7c cooler than previous Lian Li 216 mid tower. Definitely recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Heavy but worth it
reviews.reviewText: The case is super nice! Lots of room. Good cable management ( wish there was a little more room in the back for your cables… my case came and the hinges for the doors are defective. This case is very heavy empty. So once full (be ready to work your muscles). White looks amazing with all the rgb! Would highly recommend if your wanting to expand your PC and also get the maximum air flow.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very Clean, well thought out and good looking case...it's HUGE btw!
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Corsair put together REALLY nice cases...this one is no exception. It's HUGE btw, and heavy. Wire management is super nice, you get swing out doors as well as an interior metal door to keep all your wires behind. It has many usb front panel ports which are always handy to have. The case is also modular so if you wanted to vertically mount stuff, you could...expose or shroud the power supply, up to you...There are many spots for hard drives of all sizes from large 3.5's down to SSD's. One nice feature is the ease of removing the glass at the fans - they're held securely in place with friction fittings...and the fan mesh is a vinyl that is magnetically held in place so you can pull it out completely and get any dust off with ease. Overall, I'm super happy with the case, how it looks and it's function. It's well thought out and I'd defiantly suggest it to anyone looking to do a new build - this one is future proof in my opinion. Here are some pics of my build using the case...my rooms lighting is set for a gaming environment but the case is white...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Top tier full-tower case
reviews.reviewText: This case is absolutely amazing and I am so happy with my purchase. The cable management is excellent, very spacey although there is a really dumb panel in the back that doesn't close if you have many cables. I just simply took it off with no issues. Airflow is great and the seamless integration with iCUE thanks to the pre-installed fans makes adjusting the fans (which are deadly silent on full blast) really simple. The case is HUGE so be prepared for that, fits my 4090, 360mm radiators, 120mm fans and atx mobo with room to spare. It's made out of very high quality material and as a result is extremely heavy and somewhat hard to work with but worth the price if you really need the room like I did (looks so much better than the pictures as well).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Solid, huge case, but harder to work with than I thought
reviews.reviewText: Case is very nice looking, I got my build together and looking good in the end, but was a bit harder to work with than I thought it'd be given its size.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I’m a little ambivalent…. so I apologize for the “stream of consciousness” nature of this review.- I chose this because I was building with an EATX mobo, RTX4090 and 1600w power supply, so I thought room was the important thing.-I also use Corsair cooling so having iCUE fans was very nice.- Space to build and cable management is excellent.- The final computer looks a bit “Volvo” - boxy but good.- There’s a few plastic-clip latches that could be magnetic.- Four USB-A 3 ports on the front (top)- The airflow is good, even with all the glass panels fitted.- The case fans are of excellent quality.- I used a Seasonic 1600W PSU and a 420mm corsair AIO at the front with six fans in push-pull, this meant I was limited to one hard-drive cage.I gave five stars because it’s perfect for what it is and I’m happy with the new PC, but if/when I build another I’ll squeeze it all into a Phanteks P600S (a very pretty case that I used twice before).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I liked that it comes with 4 140mm fans already installed. The build quality is nice. I guess the only negative that probably can't be helped without lowering quality is the weight. This case empty is heavy. Even heavier with all the components inside. Enjoy this awesome case.

If you’re building your first computer or maybe your second I would recommend this one for one reason and one reason only. SPACE! This thing is massive, huge, gigantic!Lots of space for putting your components in and also lots of space on the side for beginner cable management. You will not run out of space, can handle my threadripper and dual 4090’s while still having space to put an entire custom loop in with a over sized tank.

This case is the best pc case on this earth. Everything in this case is so accessible and very easy to assemble. It has lots of room for all types of new pc parts (especially the new graphics cards that are getting bigger and bigger) The only thing that I would mention (that wasn't and issue for me) make sure you have lots of room for this case because it is very big. 10/10 would highly recommend!
Très bon boîtier qui contient énormément de choses et répondra à chacun des besoins ( usb-c, rack a disques, gestion des ventilateurs...)Il pèse son poids mais il est parfait une fois mis en place

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 17, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The case looks stunning with lot's of room with removable parts to set it up the way you like, it come with 4 140m RGB fan run very quiet even at full speed. The cable management was OK but I found the inner door make the space a bit tight needed to move the cables around to able shut the door, but make a clean look when you open the first door.The case is very heavy OK not going to move it a lot, but if you need too, I found it a lot easier to move the glass and slide off the door first

Das Corsair iCUE 7000X RGB ist ein großes Gehäuse im Full-Tower-Format. Es ist aus Aluminium gefertigt und verfügt über ein modernes Design mit einem großen Seitenpanel aus gehärtetem Glas. Das Gehäuse bietet viel Platz für eine Vielzahl von Komponenten, einschließlich ATX-, E-ATX- und Micro-ATX-Mainboards, bis zu 18 Laufwerke (12 x 3,5 Zoll und 6 x 2,5 Zoll) und bis zu drei 480-mm-Radiatoren.Das iCUE 7000X RGB ist mit drei 140-mm-RGB-Lüftern ausgestattet, die über das Corsair iCUE-Softwareprogramm gesteuert werden können. Das Gehäuse verfügt auch über einen integrierten Commander CORE XT-Hub, der die Steuerung von bis zu 63 RGB-Lichteffekten ermöglicht.Insgesamt ist das Corsair iCUE 7000X RGB ein hochwertiges Gehäuse mit viel Platz und einer Vielzahl von Funktionen. Es ist eine gute Wahl für Benutzer, die ein leistungsstarkes und elegantes Gehäuse für ihren High-End-PC suchen.Hier sind einige der Vor- und Nachteile des Corsair iCUE 7000X RGB:Vorteile: Hochwertige Verarbeitung Modernes Design Viel Platz für Komponenten Drei 140-mm-RGB-Lüfter Integrierter Commander CORE XT-Hub Steuerung über Corsair iCUE-SoftwareprogrammNachteile: Teuer SchwerInsgesamt ist das Corsair iCUE 7000X RGB ein hervorragendes Gehäuse mit vielen Vorteilen. Es ist jedoch auch relativ teuer und schwer. Wenn Sie nach einem günstigeren und leichteren Gehäuse suchen, gibt es viele andere gute Optionen auf dem Markt.
